meanings.sent1: I will prebind the pages of my report before the presentation.
meanings.sent2: She always prebinds her notebooks to keep them organized.
meanings.sent3: The librarian prebound the new books to make them easier to shelve.
meanings.sent4: The chef prebinds the ingredients together before cooking.
meanings.sent5: Prebinding the documents will save time later on.

meanings.definition: The act of binding something in advance.
meanings.sent1: The prebinding of the book made it sturdy and durable.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the prebinding on the journal and appreciated the quality.
meanings.sent3: The prebinding of the gift added a special touch to the presentation.
meanings.sent4: The prebinding of the contract symbolized a commitment between the parties.
meanings.sent5: The prebinding of the manuscript ensured it stayed intact during shipping.
